firstDescr: <0>Ubähnchen</0> is a map of the Berlin trains. The design is inspired by the game Minimetro.

how.title: How it works
how.text: Modes can be toggled by clicking <1>Live mode</1> or <3>Scheduled mode</3>, on the top right of the window.

disclaimer.text: Ubähnchen is an independent amateur website, not connected to any company or organisation. It's free, free of ads and cookies. The displayed date can be inacurate. Use at your own risk, blablabla...
disclaimer.title: Disclaimer

live.title: Live mode (beta)
live.vbbDisclaimer: Powered by VBB GmbH. All information without guarantee.
live.text: The <2>HAFAS API <1></1></2> has a “radar” endpoint, giving the position of all trains and <5>animation data</5>, containing stops information (origin, target, time) and a <7>proc</7> value, which I think means <10>“position between 2 stops in percent“</10>.
live.unfortunately: Unfortunately, there are some implementation mistakes in Ubähnchen causing trains to move weirdly or disappear.

planned.title: Planned mode
planned.text: Schedules are extracted from the <2>GTFS data of the VBB<1></1></2> (released on <5>{{fileDateInUse}}</5>) which contains <7>arrival time</7> and <10>departure time</10> for a time period of several months. The movement of the trains is simulated at constant speed between stations.
planned.outdate: ⚠️ New GTFS data from VBB is available, making this website out of date. It was released on <2>{{gtfsLastModified}}</2>.
